LayoutNode.SRC: Leadoff means blastoff for Bryce Harper and the Nats
• Facebook
• Twitter
Eddie MatzESPN Senior Writer
May 5, 2018

LayoutNode.Content: WASHINGTON -- The force was with Bryce Harper . Lots of force.
LayoutNode.SRC: WASHINGTON -- The force was with Bryce Harper. Lots of force.
• Facebook Messenger
• Pinterest

LayoutNode.Content: Even though Nationals Park is waiting until Saturday to hold its official Star Wars Dayfestivities, Harper chose to celebrate on May the Fourth by putting on a powerdisplay that could’ve made a lightsaber blush.
LayoutNode.SRC: Even though Nationals Park is waiting until Saturday to hold its official Star Wars Day festivities, Harper chose to celebrate on May the Fourth by putting on a power display that could’ve made a lightsaber blush.
Email

LayoutNode.Content: New leadoff man Bryce Harper just wants to hit 170d - Eddie Matz
LayoutNode.SRC: New leadoff man Bryce Harper just wants to hitNew leadoff man Bryce Harper just wants to hit170d - Eddie Matz

LayoutNode.Content: Leading off in the bottom of the first, the Washington Nationals slugger hit an opposite-field homer off Philadelphia Phillies starter Nick Pivetta . The very next inning, he obliterated a first-pitch changeup from Pivetta, sending it way beyond the center-field wall for his second blast of the game. The 473-foot laser was Harper’s longest long ball since the beginning of the Statcast era.
LayoutNode.SRC: Leading off in the bottom of the first, the Washington Nationals slugger hit anopposite-field homer off Philadelphia Phillies starter Nick Pivetta. The very nextinning, he obliterated a first-pitch changeup from Pivetta, sending it way beyond thecenter-field wall for his second blast of the game. The 473-foot laser was Harper’slongest long ball since the beginning of the Statcast era.

LayoutNode.Content: Propelled by Harper’s big night, the defending National League East champs rattledoff their sixth straight win. The past four of those have come since the team’s starright fielder likened Washington to a minor league squad.
LayoutNode.SRC: Propelled by Harper’s big night, the defending National League East champs rattled off their sixth straight win. The past four of those have come since the team’s star right fielder likened Washington to a minor league squad.

LayoutNode.Content: On Friday, Washington put its money where Harper’s mouth was. In the clubhousebefore the game, and on the field during batting practice, most of the Nationalsdonned gray T-shirts that featured the logo of the Syracuse Chiefs, the club’s Triple-Aaffiliate. Then the Nats went out and looked like anything but a minor league team.
LayoutNode.SRC: On Friday, Washington put its money where Harper’s mouth was. In the clubhouse before the game, and on the field during batting practice, most of the Nationals donned gray T-shirts that featured the logo of the Syracuse Chiefs, the club’s Triple-A affiliate. Then the Nats went out and looked like anything but a minor league team.
373d - Eddie Matz

LayoutNode.Content: “The guy’s doing it all,” Gonzalez said of Adams. “It was just unreal what he did onthat catch.”
LayoutNode.SRC: “The guy’s doing it all,” Gonzalez said of Adams. “It was just unreal what he did on that catch.”

LayoutNode.Content: Equally unreal is what Adams has been doing at the plate. Since taking over for Harper in the 3-hole, the 29-year-old former Cardinal is hitting .429 and has driven in seven runs in four games. He also has drawn four walks against one strikeout.
LayoutNode.SRC: Equally unreal is what Adams has been doing at the plate. Since taking over forHarper in the 3-hole, the 29-year-old former Cardinal is hitting .429 and has driven inseven runs in four games. He also has drawn four walks against one strikeout.

LayoutNode.Content: “I'm not one to really dwell on stuff like this,” Adams said of his hot streak, “but it'sdefinitely feeling good. So, I’m just going to keep running out there with confidenceevery day.”
LayoutNode.SRC: “I'm not one to really dwell on stuff like this,” Adams said of his hot streak, “but it's definitely feeling good. So, I’m just going to keep running out there with confidence every day.”

LayoutNode.Content: For as much confidence as Adams has in himself, he has even more in his team’s newleadoff hitter.
LayoutNode.SRC: For as much confidence as Adams has in himself, he has even more in his team’s new leadoff hitter.

LayoutNode.Content: “He's a special player,” Adams said of Harper. “His work ethic, one. He gets hereearly, gets his work done and just the way he prepares; he's an animal out there, soit's fun to share the field with him.”
LayoutNode.SRC: “He's a special player,” Adams said of Harper. “His work ethic, one. He gets here early, gets his work done and just the way he prepares; he's an animal out there, so it's fun to share the field with him.”

LayoutNode.Content: Lately, it has been fun for all the Nationals to share the field, which wasn’t the case a week ago. After winning four straight to start the season, they lost 16 of their next 23 contests to fall five games under .500 for the first time since April 2015. But thanks to their recent winning streak, they finally climbed back above .500 on Friday for the first time in over three weeks, and they have moved to within three games of the first-place Atlanta Braves .
LayoutNode.SRC: Lately, it has been fun for all theNationals to share the field, which wasn’tthe case a week ago. After winning fourstraight to start the season, they lost 16of their next 23 contests to fall five gamesunder .500 for the first time since April2015. But thanks to their recent winningstreak, they finally climbed back above.500 on Friday for the first time in overthree weeks, and they have moved to within three games of the first-place Atlanta BravesAtlanta Braves.

LayoutNode.Content: “We’re doing a great job,” Harper said. “Keep having good at-bats, keep pitching theball well. Bullpen threw the ball well. As a team, just trying to get some at-bats going,staying strong out there.”
LayoutNode.SRC: “We’re doing a great job,” Harper said. “Keep having good at-bats, keep pitching the ball well. Bullpen threw the ball well. As a team, just trying to get some at-bats going, staying strong out there.”

LayoutNode.Content: On Friday, with the force on their side, they were plenty strong.
LayoutNode.SRC: On Friday, with the force on their side, they were plenty strong.
